Bandera, Hitler and Putin
Boris Sokolov ( blog Free space ) 25.03.2014

In his article "Playing in Bandera " my esteemed colleague Ilya Milstein , it seems to me , is not entirely free from stereotypes of Soviet propaganda , successfully repeated the current Kremlin . Incorrectly equate Bandera and fascists. Stepan Bandera , the Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists ( OUN) and the Ukrainian Insurgent Army ( UPA ) - this is not the Nazis , and nationalists , such as the Irish Republican Army (IRA ) , the Basque separatist organization ETA , the Scottish National Party and many others. Egyptian nationalist leaders were organizing " Free Officers " Gamal Abdel Nasser and Anwar Sadat , who fought against the British occupation during the Second World War , as Bandera collaborated with the Axis powers . Like the Irish and Basque nationalists , Bandera used terrorist methods of struggle. The most notorious terrorist act was to kill Interior Minister Bronislaw Peratskogo for the organization which Bandera received a life sentence . As for the modern Ukrainian political parties and movements , the nationalist party can be considered "Freedom" Oleg Tyagniboka and some factions of the "right sector " Dmitry Yarosh . It is no coincidence Russian propaganda deliberately muddles party affiliation commandant Evromaydana Andrew Parubiya , writing in his "Freedom " , whereas in fact he is a member " of the Fatherland . " And such parties as the "Fatherland " and " blow," are not nationalistic . This party with a very amorphous political programs created under specific leaders. Ilya Milstein states: " Nowhere ( except Poland ) Nazi extermination machine did not function as effectively (as in Ukraine. - BS ) , which greatly contributed to the enthusiasm of the local population , which has deep historical roots . " In fact, the Nazi extermination machine Jews and other " undesirables " in all the occupied territories of Eastern Europe were approximately equally effective and with the participation of the local population . In the occupied Soviet territory Jews exterminated Einsatzgruppen , where the Germans were only a third of the personnel. The remaining two-thirds - is mostly former Soviet prisoners of war . And because of them dominated by Russian , then the role of " God-bearing people " in the Holocaust should not be underestimated . As for the OUN and UPA , they during the Second World War really committed genocide - but not Jews, and the Polish population in Volhynia and Galicia, where in 1943-1944 were killed during the "ethnic cleansing" of 30 to 60 thousand Poles of the number of civilians. Jews also pursued primarily as a " Bolshevik agents" purposefully destroying those who came to the Western Ukraine in the convoy of Soviet troops to occupy the various administrative . positions. Of course , the case of the murder of Jews from among the civilian population UPA fighters , but these excesses were no more than a murder of Jews of Polish and Soviet partisans . So , one of the leaders of the Soviet partisans , Hero of the Soviet Union Kirill Orlovsky recalled how in Belarus " I organized a detachment Kirov exclusively from Jews who escaped from Nazi execution. I knew that for me are incredible hardships , but I was not afraid of difficulties , went for it only because all around us and partisan guerrilla detachments Connection Baranovichi and Pinsk areas away from these people. Killings were blocked. For example, " partisans " anti-Semitic Tsygankova squad killed 11 people of the Jews , the peasants of the village Radzhalovichi Pinsk region killed 17 people of the Jews , " partisans " Detachment . CSHorsa killed 7 people Jews " ( RGASPI, f . 625 , op. 1 , 22, p. 1186 ) . It is known that in the ranks of the UPA were Jews who did not hide their nationality. The most famous of them - Hirsch (Michael) Keller. one of the leaders of the uprising Kengir camp in 1954 . Prisoners Ukrainians - former UPA fighters and their " accomplices " - Keller chose as its representative to the headquarters of the uprising. This proves once again that at the program level in the UPA was not anti-Semitism . And I think that for Keller and other Jewish fighters OUN slogan " Glory to Ukraine ! - Heroes of glory! " Was not an empty phrase . Ilya Milstein talks about " painful choice between Putin and Bandera , Putin and Hitler . " But no such choice because Putin - is Hitler today that it has convincingly demonstrated its aggression against Ukraine , occupation and annexation of the Crimea. Democrats in Russia and around the world must demand the withdrawal of Russian troops from the Crimea and the administration and the return of the region under the sovereignty of Ukraine . But hopes for democratic forces in Russia now, with the restoration of total propaganda and public mindedness . little. Something can only change the sanctions imposed by the Western countries . But they should not wear a demonstrative , symbolic , and really affect the most sensitive sectors of the Russian economy and finance . This is the only way to stop the new Hitler and further destabilization of international relations.

"Was Hitler done with the Anschluss? No. Neither will Russia be satisfied just with Ukraine. And after Ukraine, Russia can only have one target – the Baltic states. Russia has occupied Crimea. Western countries, including Estonia, are confused and able to utter only outdated and increasingly embarrassing platitudes. Russia will not wait for EU foreign ministers to eventually convene for a meeting, but is making hay while the sun shines – it is moving new military units and equipment to Crimea, expanding the conflict to eastern and southern Ukraine, and using Victor Yanukovych, who has sought refuge in Russia, to question the legitimacy of the people who seized power in Kyiv, and to create a cover for its criminal activities. At the same time, the West is prattling in the United Nations where Russia holds veto rights at the Security Council, and making noise in the OSCE where all decisions need a consensus, which Russia (or any of its vassals) will naturally not allow to happen, while letting the leaders of big countries issue comically toothless statements instead. And with each passing day, Moscow is adding to the hard facts which the so-called international community must face. In a nutshell, Russia is fighting ruthlessly and brutally, and proving to all that the post-Cold War world has been replaced by the post-post-Cold War world in which Moscow no longer considers the current international order, law, and organizations competent to solve problems. What is applicable then? From Moscow’s point of view, only force and the willingness to sacrifice human lives when force is applied. Is the West willing to do that? That is extremely unlikely. It is one thing to mount military operations against Afghan poppy growers and quite another to accept the challenge of a nuclear power with the world’s largest territory and the richest deposits of natural resources, which feels cornered in a deepening confrontation with the West and is not going to surrender its habitats without a fight. Moscow knows – and so does the West but it is not willing to admit it even to itself – that Western civilization in its decadence has reached the final stage of its degradation where only money and comfort count. Careerists and anglers, who are able to navigate the ship only in good weather, have risen to the top during decades of inert existence. They will lose their heads in a storm, and can only utter banalities and behave accordingly. Oswald Spengler in his “The Decline of the West” predicted more than correctly that money will bring down Western democracy (that is exactly what has already happened), and then the power of money will be conquered by force. Europe, fighting for the rainbow flag and gender quotas, is a complete impotent in that respect; the United States, on the other hand, when considering intervening, is thinking about moves of a broader global game and must inevitably take into account that average Americans do not have a clue where someplace called Crimea is located. Moreover, the United States is tired of the problems of the rest of the world and wants to take a rest. And we do not know whether it intends to wake up and do something if a small country like Estonia screams for help at some point. This is the essence of an existential question for a wider audience: Is the West (especially the United States) willing to start what would likely be a truly uncompromising fight in order to win Crimea, as well as the eastern and southern Ukraine back from Moscow? That is not likely. It is much more likely that the West will behave exactly the way it did in 1938 when Germany under the leadership of Adolf Hitler demanded that they have Czechoslovakia, the independence and territorial integrity of which had been guaranteed by the Soviet Union and France in the League of Nations. At the time, the issue was left for Britain’s Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain to mediate, which resulted in Czechoslovakia being left to Hitler to tear apart. Was Hitler satisfied with that? No. Neither will Russia be satisfied with this. After Ukraine, Russia will only have one target – the Baltic states. It is naive to maintain that the West can influence Russia by imposing sanctions and freezing funds of the ruling kleptocratic clique. Putin & Co. have transferred their assets to a safe place by now, and Russia can withstand a long economic blockade stoically because the average Russian, unlike Europeans and Americans, is able to survive on vodka and potatoes alone. But it is Germany which will be unable to stay in business without Russian raw materials. In 2008, Russia tested the West by launching a military attack against Georgia. The West failed the test. According to the peace treaty, negotiated with the French president as a mediator, Russia should have withdrawn troops from South Ossetia and Abkhazia, but we all know very well that Moscow has so far not done that. It is highly unlikely that Russia will leave Crimea now that it has been conquered; even moreso, considering that historically it has never been an organic part of Ukraine. In fact, Ukraine has only one – bloody – option to regain control over Crimea (and other potentially separatist regions). That means mobilizing the armed forces and going against the aggressor with arms. Just like Yanukovych was brought down at a price of victims’ blood, Russia will retreat when it meets decisive armed resistance. Because Russia is not nearly as strong as it makes itself out to be. The authorities currently in power in Kyiv with all their economic problems are probably too much Western puppets to do what they are obliged to do under the Ukrainian Constitution. Sacrificing a Crimea or a Donetsk means nothing for Western countries which are sprawling in their own comfort zone. After all, Western leaders, brought up in the spirit of the 1960′s hippie ideology, are familiar with only one motto – “Make love, not war”. Russia is familiar with the lyrics of a different song: “A yesly zavtra voyna … ” – if there is war tomorrow. "

Mart Helme

EXISTENCE
Antonio De Dominicis

A beautiful entanglement and mean
of moods
singing
forgetting the words
themselves. Maybe so big skies
not dwell in your eyes ? And huge melodies jump in there head ? Do not say the unsayable
or you'll end up thinking
that even the good changes
are no more than words

Enjoy your existence.

Spring of Poets

Alda Merino . The poets work at night

The poets work at night
when the weather is not urgent on them,
silent when the crowd noise
and ends the lynching of hours. The poets working in the dark
as hawks or night nightingales
the sweetest song
and fear of offending God . But poets , in their silence
make much more noise
a golden dome of stars.

Here is the beginning of the little show tonight. The rest, you have to be there to feel it and see it. At the Teatro del Sale , from 1930. I remember ... / / I remember that I was a child . A happy child , although it can be a child of the 60s. The backyard is large, the yard is as big as the whole world. Above the roof of the house opposite there is a clear blue sky with small white clouds. A wire stretched between the terrace of your house and that of the nearby . We put on clean clothes , drying in the sun . And those wires are pulled , magically , so that the clothes come close to the terrace in front of the lady , and vice versa. From the balcony far away , a song . Laugh , laugh , laugh ... The child does not know anything about who that singer. I do not even know who is laughing , and why. And what are love stories . But hear that song a hundred times , from the front terrace. And it's the first song I remember .

una lettera da San Casciano

By JOSEF JOFFE
March 6, 2014 2:28 p.m. ET
Niccolò Machiavelli, the father of realpolitik, has sent a message from beyond the grave to Russian President Vladimir Putin following his grab of the Crimea. Through divine inspiration and the services of an elite medium, your correspondent has obtained the document, reprinted below. Esteemed Mr. President:

For the last 500 years, I have been observing earthly power politics. As an admirer of Richelieu, Palmerston and Kissinger, I want to congratulate you. You are one of my best students, and you outwitted Barack Obama, Angela Merkel and this Frenchman with the Dutch name. With the Second Crimean War, you also outdid Joseph Stalin and Nikita Khrushchev. Stalin was actually a timid man, who didn't go beyond what his World War II armies had occupied. Khrushchev was a wild-eyed adventurist who almost unleashed World War II over Cuba. Yet you, Mr. President, have been both ruthless and prudent—just what I prescribed in "The Prince. " You Russians have distilled my wisdom into a pithy phrase: Kto kovo—who dominates whom? And you have beautifully executed my central idea. I never preached violence to the max, but the "economy of force"—how to get more with less. The Crimean caper was a masterpiece of smart power politics. You did everything right. You grabbed an opportunity when you saw it. First, you calculated the "correlation of forces," to use a Soviet term, and realized that it was vastly in your favor. Who would fight you? A Ukrainian leadership in chaos? A flimsy Ukrainian army? The EU that could not even bomb Libya without the U.S. Air Force? Barack Obama's America? Then, you assessed political geography correctly. The rule is never to take on a superior enemy like the West on his own turf. You test his mettle on his periphery. The EU is an imposing economic power, but it lacks the will and the wherewithal to project its might. The U.S. has assets galore, but no longer the will to act as world power. So you could shrug them off. Next, you factor in geography proper. Globally, the West is far superior to Russia, but regionally, you were the Man. You had the "interior lines," as the great Prussian strategist Carl von Clausewitz put it; the West was a thousand miles away. And your troops were already in place on the Crimea—tanks, planes and all. Enlarge Image

Niccolò Machiavelli Getty Images/Universal Images Group

Now to the balance of interests, a more subtle concept. The EU has been contesting you over Ukraine, but more as a confused afterthought. Your country had more compelling fish to fry: Ukraine as former Russian heartland plus an ethnic majority in the Crimea, a strategic gem that Khrushchev had absentmindedly given away to Ukraine 60 years ago. So you also held the psychological advantage that comes with having more skin in the game. Khrushchev blithely ignored the balance of interests in the Caribbean. Otherwise he would not have moved his missiles into Cuba in 1962, just 90 miles off the U.S. coast. Sixty percent ethnic Russians in the Crimea, dare I say, also added a whiff of legitimacy. Doesn't the West always sermonize about the "responsibility to protect? " Didn't it go to war for the Kosovars? Best of all, you are a true Machiavellian when it comes to the economy of violence. Just enough, never too much, and with minimal risks. So you didn't grab eastern Ukraine, which might have really riled the West and triggered a costly insurgency. You merely harvested the low-hanging fruit of Crimea, and with a fabulous profit. In Kiev, the "educative" impact will be enormous. Whoever gains power there will sing the theme of "democracy" and "EU affiliation" sotto voce. Here, my pupil, beckons the biggest payoff. You need not fear the democratic contagion of the Maidan spilling over into your own country. Not for a long time. What a boost to your "street cred" in the rivalry of nations! With a small investment, you have amassed what Mr. Obama no longer has—and what the Europeans lost long ago: a reputation for ruthlessness and the readiness to use force. Power is when you don't have to wield it—when you don't have to threaten, let alone execute, to get your way. Watch respect for Russia grow in Poland and in the Baltics. And don't worry about the fallout. You grabbed Abkhasia and South Ossetia with a little blitzkrieg in 2008. Today, nobody talks about Georgia any more. Why does the "economy of violence" generate even richer profits now than in my Florentine days? We live in a split world. In Asia and Africa, mayhem is as present or possible as ever. Call this the "Damascus-Pyongyang Belt. " Yet in the "Berlin-Berkeley Belt," force as a tool of statecraft has virtually disappeared. Given the West's dismal record in Afghanistan and Iraq, even the supposed "last remaining superpower"—the U.S.—is now loath to resort to the ultima ratio. And that offers you wondrous opportunities. When the supply of force contracts, even a little bit goes a long way, as you just proved in the Crimea. When American power recedes, you can forge ahead with little risk—as you already did in Syria. In the West, Chancellor Merkel has just pooh-poohed you as somebody who "lives in another world. " Yes, you do live in the 19th century—in a world of zero-sum games where your rivals' loss is your reward, where power is possession, and where kto kovo trumps mutual gain. The West lives in the 21st century, where welfare trumps warfare and rules trump reason of state. This is why you won so handily in the Crimea. There is just one problem, Mr. President. A nation's true greatness comes from responsibility. You have just reaffirmed a historic Russian habit: You would rather be the great spoiler and outsider. It is self-isolation, but not at all splendid. Good luck, Vladimir. Yours truly,

Niccolo Machiavelli

HAPPENS IN ROME - TILT - The battle for cultural de- construct prejudices and gender stereotypes makes strides with the opening of courses for the operators of the city of Rome. Punctual attacks come from newspapers and groups such as the Militia Christi that once again would like to block attempts to solve the sacred roots of the heavy social and economic problems due to the cages imposed by a culture to " sex shop" . From the time we deal with these problems and especially their consequences that accompany growth in boys and girls become teenagers and adults often fragile and depressed. For this we are alongside SHOCK - Social Promotion Association and the Archive in the resistance to these attacks and the political and cultural battle that states and disseminate good practices that they are experimenting with the city of Rome. Aware that from childhood you can limit the damage caused by the hypocritical social constructions which for too long we have to live , we reject the attacks on the sender , convinced that the fear of losing control over people is the spring that drives these individuals to attack the good practices of liberation. We will be at your side and will spread the idea that the "school makes all the difference . "

Rome and Genoa presenting with a joint and integrated two important exhibitions focusing on the work of the Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The exhibition in Rome , at the Quirinal Stables , from March 20 to August 31, 2014 , explores Frida Kahlo and her relationship with the artistic movements of the time, Mexican Modernism from the International Surrealism , analyzing the influences on his work . The exhibition in Genoa , Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, the Palazzo Ducale, from September 20, 2014 to 15 February 2015 continues the story begun analyzing the private universe of Frida, a universe of great suffering , the center of which will always be the husband Diego Rivera , outlining a relationship that will leave huge traces in his art. http://www.scuderiequirinale.it/categorie/mostra-frida-kahlo

Leaving Caracas after 2 months. I'm really sad about the country situation and the conflict between opposition and chavists. But what is make me more sad as a photographer is how western media represented the situation. A lot of propaganda and informations without any journalistic bases…all I saw is not my idea of journalism, and I'm sure that most of my western friends doesn't know what is happening in venezuela and what happened in the last 15 years. I hope that venezuelan people will be able to build their future in a pacific way, with a real dialogue between the 2 souls of the country…will be long and hard, maybe harder that throw stones, but it will be the only real way to a better democracy. Hugs to all my venezuelan friends, the chavists, the opposition ones, and also the ones that are now in the middle. Los quiero mucho. Pietro Paolini

Sto lasciando Caracas dopo 2 mesi. Sono molto triste per la situazione del paese ed il conflitto tra opposizione e chavisti. Ma ciò che mi rende più triste come fotografo è come i media occidentali hanno rappresentato la situazione. Un sacco di propaganda e di informazioni senza basi giornalistiche ... tutto quello che ho visto non è la mia idea di giornalismo, e sono sicuro che molti dei miei amici occidentali non sanno cosa e perché sta accadendo in Venezuela e quello che è successo negli ultimi 15 anni. Spero che il popolo venezuelano sarà in grado di costruire il proprio futuro in modo pacifico, con un vero dialogo tra le due anime del paese ... sarà una strada lunga e difficile, forse più difficile da percorrere che lanciare pietre, ma sarà l'unico vero modo per costruire una migliore democrazia. Un abbraccio a tutti i miei amici Venezuelani, i chavisti, quelli di opposizione, e anche quelli che stanno un po nel mezzo. Los quiero mucho. Pietro Paolini

ROME ILLA

Mario Picchi

From day one he turns to me in the head
as a schoolboy still sleepy
that does not decide to get out of bed . To listen to him , to paraphrase Catullus
and with a lot of dots on i,
I should begin this letter as follows:
" Mario , our Rome , the Rome
Rome that we loved so much ... "
and with bitter anger betrayed lover ,
go ahead by dint of regrets,
not to mention some rude epithet
from the sidewalk. " Literature in part -
interjected my time in cricket
speaking - I find it stupid and unfair. What do you miss you ? the glories of the hierarchy ? or the nefarious post-war
the slum dwellers in Testaccio and Aniene ,
rags to Portaportese ,
the black bag and all the miseries
celebrated by neo-realist film ? And that your complaining about? the room sublet
with Rear Window, or the night tram
from night school , unleashed in the city
deserted , that you wake up to the curves
with boos and shocks ? In fact ,
what you regret , you and your other peers,
is , as usual, lost time,
the youth went to the shredder . "
I would like to , I tried to reply, just one thing,
that I could still enjoy :
walk to Rome without danger of death. "That's right - he insisted - Rome is dirty and chaotic,
the exhaust gases of the traffic
marble crumbles , dried pine , greasy walls ,
and breathes with a quarter of a lung. But I imagine it full of chariots,
four shots , cab and barrozze ,
with bays , grays , palfreys and rough ,
donkeys and mules parked on every corner ? Passeggeresti quieter ? "
It will mean - I rimbeccato angry -
that when a barbarian on horseback
Bucephalus of his roaring , I arroterà shoulders
while through the course of the stripes
I will say here is that passing an archangel ;
I was touched by grace ! *
Last night I woke up with a start
from a nightmare of naked people , whooping ,
that climbed over the barricades , waving
arms , screaming headlines and figures
against me in the box that was protesting
my innocence. Sitting on the bed ,
while calmavo the heartbeat , I thought
Calcutta , Mexico City , Cairo,
and to all those rings that surround it,
such as halos , the metropolis of the world ,
when away from Bags and monuments,
neat neighborhoods with streets and gardens ,
an outcast humanity grows his children
in dormitories of sheet metal, amid hardships
and crimes experienced as fate ,
blacks and vices that soften the time
of that one flaw that nature imposes :
survive to reproduce ...
Captious is cricket, reflected,
with his irritating common sense
that castrates hopes and longings ;
but more insidious is the dream , and these thoughts ,
that are not behind a link . Perhaps contain a key. The joy has fled from our consciousness ;
Rome or Stockholm, does not change : the Story
looming, China is close : the only existing
in this belle époque that we do not enjoy
gives us no remorse guilt. And so farewell
nights out in Trastevere, raids
along the Appian Way, sunsets on the Pincio , snacks
thinking of love in the grass,
handing ear to the tales told
from the leaves and from the battlements behind the ruins :
Rome is no longer ours , Rome illa . - Rome , October 21, 1988 -

a white smile , and you do not like , I know. But maybe this is my unconscious
retaliation : circumvent your plans ,
thwart the attacks, making unnecessary
weapons , take off , in short, all the glory . from " state of alert " , Marianni of Ariodante .

Gregory Farolfi series with the abandonment ( of the twentieth century and other ghosts) and Ghost Town , Inner City . Gregory Farolfi presents the project ' Ghost Town, inner city ' , and superimposed images composed of contemporary cities , bright visions of which is obvious artificiality . They suggest an overlap of different times and places that you can create in memory and how the perception of the places where we live is always mediated by the filter of our own interpretation . In the photographic series ' The abandonment [ of the twentieth century and other ghosts ] ' , the author shows us how the factories of universal automation of the twentieth century , consisting of rigid architectural structures , have been transformed into mere piles of rubble piled worthless colonies mold primigenee ... subtle representation of continuous evolution .

The C.C.I.A.A. Siena , with the support of the Technical- Operational Promosiena coordinates the participation of companies in Siena Italy Selection Baltic , held in Tallinn May 20, 2014 . The initiative, organized nationally by the Italian Trade Connections and Italian Trade Consulting, in collaboration with the magazine Vine at the Meriton Grand Conference \u0026 Spa Hotel Tallinn , provides for a workshop ( B2B meetings ) for the introduction of agri-food products and wine Italian quality in the market in the Baltics
The event selection Baltic Italy will be the main promotional showcase the industry to be held in Estonia , with the objective of facilitating the finalization of business relationships. It will be prepared by the organizers agenda of meetings customized for each participating company . Meetings by appointment , at least 4, will be held between 10 and 15 on 20 May. After 15 meetings with importers will continue but without an appointment . To request participation is necessary to fill in the application form , the data sheet and the general conditions of participation contained in the attached file , no later than March 27, 2014 , together with the despatch of the company logo in electronic format ( jpg) . The capacity of the exhibition spaces allows for the participation of a maximum of 20 tables . Consider that the initiative has been spread nationwide. In the case of a greater number of applications for admission , received by the due date, will be respected in the chronological order of arrival. We will send confirmation of participation. Rimenendo available at the number 0577 282494 , we send best regards ,
